stories.text:
I am building it to replace Low-Orbit Ion Cannon. https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Low_Orbit_Ion_Cannon

The initial primitive version just uses Selenium to load website (Russia Today hardcoded for now) into a headless Chrome instance in a loop with cache disabled (must have Chrome installed).

The idea is to make it walk the site, download (but not actually play) streaming media, try to discover requests, that server takes most time to respond to.

Seeking contributors.

Python Project Setup – Virtual Environments and Package Management – Bas Codes

stories.text:
The reputation for most cloud provider's status pages is comically bad in that they often don't indicate an outage until it is already widespread and known by its users.

This made me wonder if anyone has experienced a provider or SaaS whose status page is trustworthy or otherwise useful in some other way.
stories.title: Ask HN: Are there cloud providers or SaaS products with useful status pages?
Interview with Sebastian Ramirez: FastAPI Creator

stories.text: I have licensed software (that I wrote) to a few Russian companies, and I periodically interact with them for support issues. My software isn't anything that would be considered "controlled" class software (e.g., crypto). However, I don't know how to tell if I am violating any sanctions. Where would I go to find out if I'm running afoul of some new restrictions?
stories.title: Ask HN: How do I know if it is legal to work with my Russian clients?
